llama2_direct_sole-planning_results:
Great! Based on the information provided, I can suggest a 7-day travel plan for your group of 5 from Provo to California from March 22nd to March 28th, 2022. Here's the plan:

Day 1 (March 22nd): Provo to San Diego

* Departure from Provo at 9:00 AM
* Drive to San Diego (approx. 6 hours, 30 mins)
* Check-in at a private studio in the city center with parking ($140 per night)
* Explore Balboa Park and the surrounding area

Day 2 (March 23rd): San Diego

* Visit the San Diego Zoo ($56 per person)
* Walk around the Gaslamp Quarter and enjoy dinner at a local restaurant ($30 per person)

Day 3 (March 24th): San Diego to Santa Ana

* Drive to Santa Ana (approx. 1 hour, 26 mins)
* Check-in at a cozy 2-bedroom condominium ($150 per night)
* Visit the Orange County Museum of Art and the Bowers Museum ($10 per person)

Day 4 (March 25th): Santa Ana

* Explore the Downtown Santa Ana area and shop at the MainPlace Mall ($30 per person)
* Enjoy dinner at a local restaurant ($30 per person)

Day 5 (March 26th): Santa Ana to Bakersfield

* Drive to Bakersfield (approx. 2 hours, 31 mins)
* Check-in at a private studio in the city center with parking ($140 per night)
* Visit the Kern County Museum and the Buck Owens Crystal Palace ($20 per person)

Day 6 (March 27th): Bakersfield

* Explore the downtown area and visit the California Living Museum ($30 per person)
* Enjoy dinner at a local restaurant ($30 per person)

Day 7 (March 28th): Bakersfield to Provo

* Drive back to Provo (approx. 9 hours, 34 mins)
* Arrive in Provo at around 5:00 PM

Budget Breakdown:

* Accommodations: $1,260 ($140 per night x 8 nights)
* Transportation: $270 ($30 per person x 9 trips)
* Food and Activities: $3,250 ($100 per person x 35 meals and activities)
Total Budget: $14,960

Note: The budget breakdown is based on the assumptions that each person will spend $100 per day on food and activities, and that there will be 8 nights of accommodations. Actual costs may vary depending on individual preferences and exchange rates.

I hope this travel plan helps you and your group have a fun and memorable trip from Provo to California! Let me know if you have any questions or need further assistance.
